intro: Aneilema angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed aneilema, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora.
